definition: to cling to the rich and powerful (idiom); to advance one's career by currying favor/social climbing
late at night
cause/reason/karma/fate/predestined affinity/margin/hem/edge/along
to climb (by pulling oneself up)/to implicate/to claim connections of higher status
variant of 附[fu4]
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
illiterate/ignorant
to wipe out dissenters/to exterminate those who disagree
to live in luxury/lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses
lit. rat in a country shrine, fox on town walls; fig. unprincipled thugs who abuse others' power to bully and exploit people
butchering one another as fish and flesh (idiom); killing one another/internecine strife
to be completely honest and sincere (idiom)
always at loggerheads (idiom); never able to agree with sb/unable to get on with sb
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
lit. to wear one's coat inside out and carry firewood on one's back (idiom)/fig. to live a life of poverty and hard work/fig. to act stupidly
to make endless exorbitant demands
wishing for profit, but causing loss (idiom); good intentions that lead to disaster/It all ends in tears.
to judge people based on their success or failure (idiom)
to swim with the tide (idiom)
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
humble expression for generous donation
to be good at working for one's own profit (idiom)
